sec.p: The extraction of cocoa beans was done as described by Womeni et al . [13]. Twenty grams of each processed cocoa powder (DCB, DTRCB 5min, DTRCB 10 min, DORCB 5 min and DORCB 10 min) was extracted with 400 mL of methanol for 48 h at room temperature. The mixture was regularly subjected to shaking during the extraction. The extract was filtered with a Whatman No. 1 filter paper, and residue was again extracted with 200 mL of methanol to ensure maximum extraction of phenolic compounds. The combined filtrates were subjected to rotary evaporation at 40 °C under reduced pressure for the removal of the solvent. The dried extract was used for further analysis.
